''[[Storge]]'' ({{polytonic|στοργή}} ''storgē'') means affection in modern Greek; it is natural affection, like that felt by parents for offspring.
 
''[[Storge]]'' ({{polytonic|στοργή}} ''storgē'') means affection in modern Greek; it is natural affection, like that felt by parents for offspring.
    −
''[[Philoxenia (Greek)|Xenia]]'' (ξενία ''philoxenía''), means hospitality in modern Greek, was an extremely important practice in ancient Greece. It was an almost ritualized friendship formed between a host and their guest, who could previously be strangers. The host fed and provided quarters for the guest, who was only expected to repay with gratitude. The importance of this can be seen throughout Greek mythology, in particular Homer's ''[[Iliad]]'' and ''[[Odyssey]]''. Greeks are known for their warm hospitality up to nowadays.
+
''[[Philoxenia (Greek)|Xenia]]'' (ξενία ''philoxenía''), means hospitality in modern Greek, was an extremely important practice in ancient Greece. It was an almost ritualized friendship formed between a host and their guest, who could previously be strangers. The host fed and provided quarters for the guest, who was only expected to repay with gratitude. The importance of this can be seen throughout Greek mythology, in particular Homer's ''[[Iliad]]'' and ''[[Odyssey]]''.
